OC221.name: Physicians
OC221.description: Physicians  (medical  doctors)  as  defined  by  ISCO  08  (code  221)  study,  diagnose,  treat  and prevent  illness,  disease,  injury,  and  other  physical  and  mental  impairments  in  humans  through the  application  of  the  principles  and  procedures  of  modern  medicine.  They  plan,  supervise  and evaluate  the  implementation  of  care  and  treatment  plans  by  other  health  care  providers,  and conduct medical education and research activities.

OC2261.name: Dentists
OC2261.description: Dentists  as  defined  by  ISCO  08  (code  2261)  diagnose,  treat  and  prevent  diseases,  injuries  and abnormalities  of  the  teeth,  mouth,  jaws  and  associated  tissues  by  applying  the  principles  and procedures  of modern  dentistry.  They  use  a  broad  range  of  specialized  diagnostic,  surgical  and other techniques to promote and restore oral health.

OC2262.name: Pharmacists
OC2262.description: Pharmacists  as  defined  by  ISCO  08  (code  2262)  store,  preserve,  compound,  and  dispense medicinal  products  and  counsel on  the  proper  use  and  adverse  effects  of  drugs  and  medicines following prescriptions issued by medical doctors and other health professionals. They contribute to researching, testing preparing, prescribing  and  monitoring medicinal therapies for optimising human health.

OC2264.name: Physiotherapists
OC2264.description: Physiotherapists assess, plan and implement rehabilitativeprograms that improve or restore human motor functions, maximize movement ability,relieve pain syndromes, and treat or prevent physical challenges associated withinjuries, diseases and other impairments. They apply a broad range of physicaltherapies and techniques such as movement, ultrasound, heating, laser and othertechniques.

OC222_322.name: Nursing professionals and midwives.
OC222_322.description: As selected by Eurostat data browser, anyway, data browser menu labels it as OC222_32222 and if we check the metadata anexes found in https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/cache/metadata/en/hlth_res_esms.htm, we see that in fact codes for all nursing professionals and midwives must be 2222, 3222 and 2221. And also 3221 if we want to include Associate professional nurses.
